Comment.Text: Here we recognize multimodal, incremental and reciprocal behavior patterns as signals or cues that are interpreted in the higher levels
Interpret the behavior patterns that are received as signals from the lower levels depending on the current role and strategy.
Here we detect, preprocess and propagate the events that are produced by the surface table whenever the user move an object.
Get the latest gaze event of the user and then delete all gaze events of the user in the fact base.
Check if the gaze event refers to a new object,that means that the user's visual focus has changed or not.
Set the new gaze focus and signal it to the relevant processes so that they see that the user's visual focus has just changed.
Recognize turn yield, hold and take cues and signal them to the higher levels. These are then interpreted depending on the role and other strategies as occupation, release or request of the floor.
Can we recognize backchannels in the same process?
Check if the user is already focusing the agent or shifts the visual focus to the agent within the next seconds.
The timeout can completely omitted or can be chosen to be larger or smaller.
This can also be encoded in role processes
The user's yield cue is interpreted as a floor release if the user is in the speaker role.

The user's turn yield pattern cannot be interpreted as resonable signal when the user is in the addressee role. This could have been a short statement which has not been recognized as turn take pattern because it was to short or a verbal backchannel pattern.
Dialog management gets event with scene started, scene stopped, role changed
